parameters.name: Category
parameters.description:
The category of the snapshot. Valid values:

*   Standard: normal snapshot
*   Flash: local snapshot

The local snapshot feature is replaced by the instant access feature. When you specify this parameter, take note of the following items:

*   If you have used local snapshots before December 14, 2020, you can use this parameter.
*   If you have not used local snapshots before December 14, 2020, you cannot use this parameter.

>  This parameter will be removed in the future. We recommend that you use other parameters to ensure future compatibility.

parameters.name: DiskId
parameters.description: The disk ID.

parameters.name: DryRun
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to perform only a dry run, without performing the actual request. Valid values:

*   true: performs only a dry run. The system checks your AccessKey pair, the permissions of the RAM user, and the required parameters. If the request passes the dry run, the DryRunOperation error code is returned. Otherwise, an error message is returned.
*   false (default): performs a dry run and performs the actual request. If the request passes the dry run, a 2xx HTTP status code is returned and the operation is performed.

parameters.name: Encrypted
parameters.description: Specifies whether the snapshot is encrypted. Default value: false.

parameters.name: Filter.1.Key
parameters.description: The key of filter 1 that is used to query resources. Set the value to `CreationStartTime`. You can specify a time by configuring both `Filter.1.Key` and `Filter.1.Value` to query resources that were created after the time.

parameters.name: Filter.1.Value
parameters.description: The value of filter 1 that is used to query resources. Set the value to a time. If you configure this parameter, you must also configure `Filter.1.Key`. Specify the time in the `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mmZ` format. The time must be in UTC.

parameters.name: Filter.2.Key
parameters.description: The key of filter 2 that is used to query resources. Set the value to `CreationEndTime`. You can specify a time by configuring both `Filter.2.Key` and `Filter.2.Value` to query resources that were created before the time.

parameters.name: Filter.2.Value
parameters.description: The value of filter 2 that is used to query resources. Set the value to a time. If you configure this parameter, you must also configure `Filter.2.Key`. Specify the time in the `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mmZ` format. The time must be in UTC.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID.

parameters.name: KMSKeyId
parameters.description: The ID of the Key Management Service (KMS) key that is used for the data disk.

parameters.name: MaxResults
parameters.description:
The maximum number of entries per page. Valid values: 1 to 100.

Default value: 10.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. You must specify the token that is obtained from the previous query as the value of NextToken.

parameters.name: PageNumber
parameters.description:
The page number. Page starts from page 1.

Default value: 1.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description:
The number of entries per page. Valid values: 1 to 100.

Default value: 10.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description: The region ID of the disk. You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~25609~~) operation to query the most recent region list.

parameters.name: ResourceGroupId
parameters.description:
The resource group ID. If you configure this parameter to query resources, up to 1,000 resources that belong to the specified resource group can be displayed in the response.

> Resources in the default resource group are displayed in the response regardless of whether you configure this parameter.

parameters.name: SnapshotIds
parameters.description: The IDs of snapshots. You can specify a JSON array that consists of up to 100 snapshot IDs. Separate the snapshot IDs with commas (,).

parameters.name: SnapshotLinkId
parameters.description: The snapshot chain ID. You can specify a JSON array that contains up to 100 snapshot chain IDs. Separate the snapshot chain IDs with commas (,).

parameters.name: SnapshotName
parameters.description: The name of the snapshot.

parameters.name: SnapshotType
parameters.description:
The type of the snapshot. Valid values:

*   auto: automatic snapshot
*   user: manual snapshot
*   all (default): all snapshot types

parameters.name: SourceDiskType
parameters.description:
The type of the source disk. Valid values:

*   system: system disk
*   data: data disk

>  The value of this parameter is not case-sensitive.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description:
The status of the snapshot. Valid values:

*   progressing: The snapshot is being created.
*   accomplished: The snapshot is created.
*   failed: The snapshot fails to be created.
*   all (default): This value indicates all snapshot states.

parameters.name: Tag
parameters.description: The tags of the snapshot.

parameters.name: Usage
parameters.description:
Specifies whether the snapshot has been used to create custom images or disks. Valid values:

*   image: The snapshot has been used to create custom images.
*   disk: The snapshot has been used to create disks.
*   image_disk: The snapshot has been used to create both custom images and data disks.
*   none: The snapshot has not been used to create custom images or disks.
